metadata.title: Science Quiz
metadata.description: Questions about physics, chemistry, biology, and astronomy
metadata.author: QuizMint

question.text: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
question.feedback: Mars is called the Red Planet because of the reddish iron oxide on its surface.

question.text: Which of these elements has the chemical symbol 'Au'?
question.feedback: Gold has the chemical symbol 'Au', derived from the Latin word 'aurum'.

question.text: Which famous scientist developed the theory of relativity?
question.feedback: Albert Einstein published his theory of relativity in 1915, revolutionizing our understanding of space, time, and gravity.

question.text: What is the smallest unit of matter?
question.feedback: Quarks are elementary particles and fundamental constituents of matter, making them the smallest known particles.

question.text: What process do plants use to convert sunlight into food?
question.feedback: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to create oxygen and energy in the form of sugar.
